text:
Hey there! I'm Rebekah, and I co-founded <https://clara.agency|Clara>, an organic SEO agency, in early 2019.

Our agency started out purely to create super high-quality content (particularly in the healthcare/wellness spaces) and has more recently branched out into content strategy, technical SEO site audits, and some backlink building work.

The :bread: + :butter:  of our business is still content creation, and it's my favorite part! We've been growing rapidly this year and have become a team of 5 in-house folks plus 7 freelancers.

Love connecting with other agency folks! I'm happy to be of help if ever you run into tricky SEO problems or just want to chat. :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.text: Clara is an organic SEO agency providing content creation and SEO management services to small- to medium-sized businesses.
attachments.fallback: Clara is an organic SEO agency providing content creation and SEO management services to small- to medium-sized businesses.

text:
Agency friends! I have an interesting question about the *mission* of an agency owner. My in-house senior editor/head of people ops has tasked me with articulating my "why" for our agency. Honestly, it's a tough question because my original 2 "whys" were that I wanted to be my own boss and wanted to grow an agency to offer people an amazing job with actual work/life balance and a ton of fun.

Obviously, that's not all that compelling.

Over time, the other "why" that's helped me get pumped about my job in the morning is that SEO agencies have gotten a bad rep for being so untrustworthy... and I like being able to change that.

So, my question is (depending on your position):
If you're in charge, *what's your "why" for running an agency?* 
If you work for, but don't run, an agency, *what is the "why" that makes your hard work worth it?*

what's your "why" for running an agency?
If you work for, but don't run, an agency,
what is the "why" that makes your hard work worth it?

text:
Here’s ours. :blush:

*Make the web a better place.*
We believe every time you publish a piece of content it should either be the best piece of content on the web for that topic or contribute something meaningful, new, insightful, or helpful to the conversation.
If it’s not, you need to rethink publishing it.

*Develop a passion for learning and growth in everyone.*
The constant pursuit of growth is something we encourage. Whether in your profession, knowledge, health, relationships, or anything else—we believe you should strive to grow ardently.
